page.title: 11ALONG THE RIVER GREAT OUSE.
page.content: On Thursday May 16th. 1985,eleven children and two teachers from Winhills County Junior School, St. Neots went on a boat trip along the{ {River Great Ouse}from the River Mill lock at Eaton Socon to the Anchor Hotel at Tempsford, a distance of four miles in each direction. The narrow boat left the boat_yard at 1.30pm and went upstream passing the point where the{St. Neots Bypass} will cross the river, and then{Little {Barford Power Station}which is now closed down. The children saw the work on the new bridge. After one hour ten minutes the boat passed under two bridges carrying the A1. Just beyond there the boat was turned round for the journey home. Before reaching the boat_yard the narrow boat had to go through the{Eaton Socon Lock.}What a good trip.
